cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles (100 km) south of Key West, Florida and 55 miles (90 km) northeast of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west across the Florida Straits tonight, then expected to turn WNW/NW into the east-central Gulf of Mexico Monday–Tuesday, curve NNE across the Florida Big Bend Thursday, and exit the Southeast U.S. coast (near GA/SC) into the Atlantic by Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast Big Bend, then the southeast Atlantic coast from northern Florida through Georgia, South Carolina and eastern North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Late Thursday night into Friday, sustained winds could reach 25–35 mph with occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (≥39 mph)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge of 1–3 ft possible at high tide as the system moves offshore
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 2–4 inches with locally higher amounts as outer rain-bands sweep across coastal South Carolina
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands and brief squalls that could interrupt cargo handling and crane operations
